question: Why the Indian constitution called as Fundamental law of the land?
option1: Because Preamble indicates the source from which constitution comes that is people of India
option2: Because Constitution envisages the fundamental rights
option3: Because Constitution of India declares great rights and freedoms to all citizens of India
option4: Because the government organs owe their origin to the constitution of India and derive their authority from & discharge their responsibilities within the framework of the constitution
answer: Because the government organs owe their origin to the constitution of India and derive their authority from & discharge their responsibilities within the framework of the constitution
explanation: Indian constitution is also called as Fundamental law of the land because the government organs owe their origin to the constitution of India and derive their authority from & discharge their responsibilities within the framework of the constitution.
